examples: They tried to treat all their children alike.

meanings.def: used after you have referred to two people or groups, to mean ‘both’ or ‘equally’
examples: Good management benefits employers and employees alike.

meanings.def: used to say that you and another person must both be very clever because you have had the same idea or agree about something
used to say that everyone should share things equally and in a fair way

idioms.def: used to say that you and another person must both be very clever because you have had the same idea or agree about something
used to say that everyone should share things equally and in a fair way

examples: My sister and I do not look alike.
Airports are all alike to me.
Though John and Andrew look exactly alike, they act quite differently.
